text: I know all the birds of the mountains. The wild animals of the field are mine.

name: Psalm 50:12
text: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world is mine, and all that is in it.

name: Psalm 50:13
text: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

name: Psalm 50:14
text: Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving. Pay your vows to the Most High.

name: Psalm 50:15
text: Call on me in the day of trouble. I will deliver you, and you will honor me."

name: Psalm 50:16
text: But to the wicked God says, "What right do you have to declare my statutes, that you have taken my covenant on your lips,

name: Psalm 50:17
text: since you hate instruction, and throw my words behind you?

name: Psalm 50:18
text: When you saw a thief, you consented with him, and have participated with adulterers.

name: Psalm 50:19
text: "You give your mouth to evil. Your tongue frames deceit.

name: Psalm 50:20
text: You sit and speak against your brother. You slander your own mother"s son.

name: Psalm 50:21
text: You have done these things, and I kept silent. You thought that I was just like you. I will rebuke you, and accuse you in front of your eyes.

name: Psalm 50:22
text: "Now consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you into pieces, and there be none to deliver.

name: Psalm 50:23
text: Whoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me, and prepares his way so that I will show God"s salvation to him."

name: Psalm 51:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David, when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba. Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.

name: Psalm 51:2
text: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity. Cleanse me from my sin.

name: Psalm 51:3
text: For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me.

name: Psalm 51:4
text: Against you, and you only, have I sinned, and done that which is evil in your sight; that you may be proved right when you speak, and justified when you judge.

name: Psalm 51:5
text: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity. In sin my mother conceived me.

name: Psalm 51:6
text: Behold, you desire truth in the inward parts. You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.

name: Psalm 51:7
text: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

name: Psalm 51:8
text: Let me hear joy and gladness, That the bones which you have broken may rejoice.

name: Psalm 51:9
text: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.

name: Psalm 51:10
text: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.

name: Psalm 51:11
text: Don"t throw me from your presence, and don"t take your holy Spirit from me.

name: Psalm 51:12
text: Restore to me the joy of your salvation. Uphold me with a willing spirit.

name: Psalm 51:13
text: Then I will teach transgressors your ways. Sinners shall be converted to you.

name: Psalm 51:14
text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue shall sing aloud of your righteousness.

name: Psalm 51:15
text: Lord, open my lips. My mouth shall declare your praise.

name: Psalm 51:16
text: For you don"t delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You have no pleasure in burnt offering.

name: Psalm 51:17
text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit. A broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

name: Psalm 51:18
text: Do well in your good pleasure to Zion. Build the walls of Jerusalem.

name: Psalm 51:19
text: Then you will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt offerings and in whole burnt offerings. Then they will offer bulls on your altar.

name: Psalm 52:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A contemplation by David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, "David has come to Abimelech"s house." Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man? God"s loving kindness endures continually.

name: Psalm 52:2
text: Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

name: Psalm 52:3
text: You love evil more than good, lying rather than speaking the truth. Selah.

name: Psalm 52:4
text: You love all devouring words, you deceitful tongue.

name: Psalm 52:5
text: God will likewise destroy you forever. He will take you up, and pluck you out of your tent, and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.

name: Psalm 52:6
text: The righteous also will see it, and fear, and laugh at him, saying,

name: Psalm 52:7
text: "Behold, this is the man who didn"t make God his strength, but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness."

name: Psalm 52:8
text: But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God"s house. I trust in God"s loving kindness forever and ever.

name: Psalm 52:9
text: I will give you thanks forever, because you have done it. I will hope in your name, for it is good, in the presence of your saints.

name: Psalm 53:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Mahalath." A contemplation by David. The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity. There is no one who does good.

name: Psalm 53:2
text: God looks down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there are any who understood, who seek after God.

name: Psalm 53:3
text: Every one of them has gone back. They have become filthy together. There is no one who does good, no, not one.

name: Psalm 53:4
text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread, and don"t call on God?

name: Psalm 53:5
text: There they were in great fear, where no fear was, for God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you. You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.

name: Psalm 53:6
text: Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God brings back his people from captivity, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

name: Psalm 54:1
text: For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David, when the Ziphites came and said to Saul, "Isn"t David hiding himself among us?" Save me, God, by your name. Vindicate me in your might.

name: Psalm 54:2
text: Hear my prayer, God. Listen to the words of my mouth.

name: Psalm 54:3
text: For strangers have risen up against me. Violent men have sought after my soul. They haven"t set God before them. Selah.

name: Psalm 54:4
text: Behold, God is my helper. The Lord is the one who sustains my soul.

name: Psalm 54:5
text: He will repay the evil to my enemies. Destroy them in your truth.

name: Psalm 54:6
text: With a free will offering, I will sacrifice to you. I will give thanks to your name, Yahweh, for it is good.

name: Psalm 54:7
text: For he has delivered me out of all trouble. My eye has seen triumph over my enemies.

name: Psalm 55:1
text: For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David. Listen to my prayer, God. Don"t hide yourself from my supplication.

name: Psalm 55:2
text: Attend to me, and answer me. I am restless in my complaint, and moan,

name: Psalm 55:3
text: Because of the voice of the enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked. For they bring suffering on me. In anger they hold a grudge against me.

name: Psalm 55:4
text: My heart is severely pained within me. The terrors of death have fallen on me.

name: Psalm 55:5
text: Fearfulness and trembling have come on me. Horror has overwhelmed me.

name: Psalm 55:6
text: I said, "Oh that I had wings like a dove! Then I would fly away, and be at rest.

name: Psalm 55:7
text: Behold, then I would wander far off. I would lodge in the wilderness." Selah.

name: Psalm 55:8
text: "I would hurry to a shelter from the stormy wind and storm."

name: Psalm 55:9
text: Confuse them, Lord, and confound their language, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

name: Psalm 55:10
text: Day and night they prowl around on its walls. Malice and abuse are also within her.

name: Psalm 55:11
text: Destructive forces are within her. Threats and lies don"t depart from her streets.

name: Psalm 55:12
text: For it was not an enemy who insulted me, then I could have endured it. Neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me, then I would have hidden myself from him.

name: Psalm 55:13
text: But it was you, a man like me, my companion, and my familiar friend.

name: Psalm 55:14
text: We took sweet fellowship together. We walked in God"s house with company.

name: Psalm 55:15
text: Let death come suddenly on them. Let them go down alive into Sheol. For wickedness is in their dwelling, in their midst.

name: Psalm 55:16
text: As for me, I will call on God. Yahweh will save me.

name: Psalm 55:17
text: Evening, morning, and at noon, I will cry out in distress. He will hear my voice.

name: Psalm 55:18
text: He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, although there are many who oppose me.

name: Psalm 55:19
text: God, who is enthroned forever, will hear, and answer them. Selah. They never change, who don"t fear God.

name: Psalm 55:20
text: He raises his hands against his friends. He has violated his covenant.

name: Psalm 55:21
text: His mouth was smooth as butter, but his heart was war. His words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.

name: Psalm 55:22
text: Cast your burden on Yahweh, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

name: Psalm 55:23
text: But you, God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction. Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days, but I will trust in you.

name: Psalm 56:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Silent Dove in Distant Lands." A poem by David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath. Be merciful to me, God, for man wants to swallow me up. All day long, he attacks and oppresses me.

name: Psalm 56:2
text: My enemies want to swallow me up all day long, for they are many who fight proudly against me.

name: Psalm 56:3
text: When I am afraid, I will put my trust in you.

name: Psalm 56:4
text: In God, I praise his word. In God, I put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can flesh do to me?

name: Psalm 56:5
text: All day long they twist my words. All their thoughts are against me for evil.

name: Psalm 56:6
text: They conspire and lurk, watching my steps, they are eager to take my life.

name: Psalm 56:7
text: Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, God.

name: Psalm 56:8
text: You number my wanderings. You put my tears into your bottle. Aren"t they in your book?

name: Psalm 56:9
text: Then my enemies shall turn back in the day that I call. I know this, that God is for me.

name: Psalm 56:10
text: In God, I will praise his word. In Yahweh, I will praise his word.

name: Psalm 56:11
text: I have put my trust in God. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

name: Psalm 56:12
text: Your vows are on me, God. I will give thank offerings to you.

name: Psalm 56:13
text: For you have delivered my soul from death, and prevented my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

name: Psalm 57:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Do Not Destroy." A poem by David, when he fled from Saul, in the cave. Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me, for my soul takes refuge in you. Yes, in the shadow of your wings, I will take refuge, until disaster has passed.

name: Psalm 57:2
text: I cry out to God Most High, to God who accomplishes my requests for me.

name: Psalm 57:3
text: He will send from heaven, and save me, he rebukes the one who is pursuing me. Selah. God will send out his loving kindness and his truth.

name: Psalm 57:4
text: My soul is among lions. I lie among those who are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

name: Psalm 57:5
text: Be exalted, God, above the heavens! Let your glory be above all the earth!

name: Psalm 57:6
text: They have prepared a net for my steps. My soul is bowed down. They dig a pit before me. They fall into its midst themselves. Selah.

name: Psalm 57:7
text: My heart is steadfast, God, my heart is steadfast. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises.

name: Psalm 57:8
text: Wake up, my glory! Wake up, psaltery and harp! I will wake up the dawn.

name: Psalm 57:9
text: I will give thanks to you, Lord, among the peoples. I will sing praises to you among the nations.

name: Psalm 57:10
text: For your great loving kindness reaches to the heavens, and your truth to the skies.

name: Psalm 57:11
text: Be exalted, God, above the heavens. Let your glory be over all the earth.

name: Psalm 58:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Do Not Destroy." A poem by David. Do you indeed speak righteousness, silent ones? Do you judge blamelessly, you sons of men?

name: Psalm 58:2
text: No, in your heart you plot injustice. You measure out the violence of your hands in the earth.

name: Psalm 58:3
text: The wicked go astray from the womb. They are wayward as soon as they are born, speaking lies.

name: Psalm 58:4
text: Their poison is like the poison of a snake; like a deaf cobra that stops its ear,

name: Psalm 58:5
text: which doesn"t listen to the voice of charmers, no matter how skillful the charmer may be.

name: Psalm 58:6
text: Break their teeth, God, in their mouth. Break out the great teeth of the young lions, Yahweh.

name: Psalm 58:7
text: Let them vanish as water that flows away. When they draw the bow, let their arrows be made blunt.

name: Psalm 58:8
text: Let them be like a snail which melts and passes away, like the stillborn child, who has not seen the sun.

name: Psalm 58:9
text: Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns, he will sweep away the green and the burning alike.

name: Psalm 58:10
text: The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance. He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked;

name: Psalm 58:11
text: so that men shall say, "Most certainly there is a reward for the righteous. Most certainly there is a God who judges the earth."

name: Psalm 59:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Do Not Destroy." A poem by David, when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him. Deliver me from my enemies, my God. Set me on high from those who rise up against me.

name: Psalm 59:2
text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity. Save me from the bloodthirsty men.

name: Psalm 59:3
text: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.

name: Psalm 59:4
text: I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me. Rise up, behold, and help me!

name: Psalm 59:5
text: You, Yahweh God of Armies, the God of Israel, rouse yourself to punish the nations. Show no mercy to the wicked traitors. Selah.

name: Psalm 59:6
text: They return at evening, howling like dogs, and prowl around the city.

name: Psalm 59:7
text: Behold, they spew with their mouth. Swords are in their lips, "For," they say, "who hears us?"

name: Psalm 59:8
text: But you, Yahweh, laugh at them. You scoff at all the nations.

name: Psalm 59:9
text: Oh, my Strength, I watch for you, for God is my high tower.

name: Psalm 59:10
text: My God will go before me with his loving kindness. God will let me look at my enemies in triumph.

name: Psalm 59:11
text: Don"t kill them, or my people may forget. Scatter them by your power, and bring them down, Lord our shield.

name: Psalm 59:12
text: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride, for the curses and lies which they utter.

name: Psalm 59:13
text: Consume them in wrath. Consume them, and they will be no more. Let them know that God rules in Jacob, to the ends of the earth. Selah.

name: Psalm 59:14
text: At evening let them return. Let them howl like a dog, and go around the city.

name: Psalm 59:15
text: They shall wander up and down for food, and wait all night if they aren"t satisfied.

name: Psalm 59:16
text: But I will sing of your strength. Yes, I will sing aloud of your loving kindness in the morning. For you have been my high tower, a refuge in the day of my distress.

name: Psalm 59:17
text: To you, my strength, I will sing praises. For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.

name: Psalm 60:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "The Lily of the Covenant." A teaching poem by David, when he fought with Aram Naharaim and with Aram Zobah, and Joab returned, and killed twelve thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt. God, you have rejected us. You have broken us down. You have been angry. Restore us, again.

name: Psalm 60:2
text: You have made the land tremble. You have torn it. Mend its fractures, for it quakes.

name: Psalm 60:3
text: You have shown your people hard things. You have made us drink the wine that makes us stagger.

name: Psalm 60:4
text: You have given a banner to those who fear you, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

name: Psalm 60:5
text: So that your beloved may be delivered, save with your right hand, and answer us.

name: Psalm 60:6
text: God has spoken from his sanctuary: "I will triumph. I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.

name: Psalm 60:7
text: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine. Ephraim also is the defense of my head. Judah is my scepter.

name: Psalm 60:8
text: Moab is my wash basin. I will throw my shoe on Edom. I shout in triumph over Philistia."

name: Psalm 60:9
text: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who has led me to Edom?

name: Psalm 60:10
text: Haven"t you, God, rejected us? You don"t go out with our armies, God.

name: Psalm 60:11
text: Give us help against the adversary, for the help of man is vain.

name: Psalm 60:12
text: Through God we shall do valiantly, for it is he who will tread down our adversaries.

name: Psalm 61:1
text: For the Chief Musician. For a stringed instrument. By David. Hear my cry, God. Listen to my prayer.

name: Psalm 61:2
text: From the end of the earth, I will call to you, when my heart is overwhelmed. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

name: Psalm 61:3
text: For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.

name: Psalm 61:4
text: I will dwell in your tent forever. I will take refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah.

name: Psalm 61:5
text: For you, God, have heard my vows. You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.

name: Psalm 61:6
text: You will prolong the king"s life; his years shall be for generations.

name: Psalm 61:7
text: He shall be enthroned in God"s presence forever. Appoint your loving kindness and truth, that they may preserve him.

name: Psalm 61:8
text: So I will sing praise to your name forever, that I may fulfill my vows daily.

name: Psalm 62:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthan. A Psalm by David. My soul rests in God alone. My salvation is from him.

name: Psalm 62:2
text: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress"I will never be greatly shaken.

name: Psalm 62:3
text: How long will you assault a man, would all of you throw him down, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?

name: Psalm 62:4
text: They fully intend to throw him down from his lofty place. They delight in lies. They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

name: Psalm 62:5
text: My soul, wait in silence for God alone, for my expectation is from him.

name: Psalm 62:6
text: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress. I will not be shaken.

name: Psalm 62:7
text: With God is my salvation and my honor. The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

name: Psalm 62:8
text: Trust in him at all times, you people. Pour out your heart before him. God is a refuge for us. Selah.

name: Psalm 62:9
text: Surely men of low degree are just a breath, and men of high degree are a lie. In the balances they will go up. They are together lighter than a breath.

name: Psalm 62:10
text: Don"t trust in oppression. Don"t become vain in robbery. If riches increase, don"t set your heart on them.

name: Psalm 62:11
text: God has spoken once; twice I have heard this, that power belongs to God.

name: Psalm 62:12
text: Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness, for you reward every man according to his work.

name: Psalm 63:1
text: A Psalm by David, when he was in the desert of Judah. God, you are my God. I will earnestly seek you. My soul thirsts for you. My flesh longs for you, in a dry and weary land, where there is no water.

name: Psalm 63:2
text: So I have seen you in the sanctuary, watching your power and your glory.

name: Psalm 63:3
text: Because your loving kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise you.

name: Psalm 63:4
text: So I will bless you while I live. I will lift up my hands in your name.

name: Psalm 63:5
text: My soul shall be satisfied as with the richest food. My mouth shall praise you with joyful lips,

name: Psalm 63:6
text: when I remember you on my bed, and think about you in the night watches.

name: Psalm 63:7
text: For you have been my help. I will rejoice in the shadow of your wings.

name: Psalm 63:8
text: My soul stays close to you. Your right hand holds me up.

name: Psalm 63:9
text: But those who seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

name: Psalm 63:10
text: They shall be given over to the power of the sword. They shall be jackal food.

name: Psalm 63:11
text: But the king shall rejoice in God. Everyone who swears by him will praise him, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be silenced.

name: Psalm 64:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. Hear my voice, God, in my complaint. Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

name: Psalm 64:2
text: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from the noisy crowd of the ones doing evil;

name: Psalm 64:3
text: who sharpen their tongue like a sword, and aim their arrows, deadly words,

name: Psalm 64:4
text: to shoot innocent men from ambushes. They shoot at him suddenly and fearlessly.

name: Psalm 64:5
text: They encourage themselves in evil plans. They talk about laying snares secretly. They say, "Who will see them?"

name: Psalm 64:6
text: They plot injustice, saying, "We have made a perfect plan!" Surely man"s mind and heart are cunning.

name: Psalm 64:7
text: But God will shoot at them. They will be suddenly struck down with an arrow.

name: Psalm 64:8
text: Their own tongues shall ruin them. All who see them will shake their heads.

name: Psalm 64:9
text: All mankind shall be afraid. They shall declare the work of God, and shall wisely ponder what he has done.

name: Psalm 64:10
text: The righteous shall be glad in Yahweh, and shall take refuge in him. All the upright in heart shall praise him!

name: Psalm 65:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song. Praise waits for you, God, in Zion. To you shall vows be performed.

name: Psalm 65:2
text: You who hear prayer, to you all men will come.

name: Psalm 65:3
text: Sins overwhelmed me, but you atoned for our transgressions.

name: Psalm 65:4
text: Blessed is one whom you choose, and cause to come near, that he may live in your courts. We will be filled with the goodness of your house, your holy temple.

name: Psalm 65:5
text: By awesome deeds of righteousness, you answer us, God of our salvation. You who are the hope of all the ends of the earth, of those who are far away on the sea;

name: Psalm 65:6
text: Who by his power forms the mountains, having armed yourself with strength;

name: Psalm 65:7
text: who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the turmoil of the nations.

name: Psalm 65:8
text: They also who dwell in faraway places are afraid at your wonders. You call the morning"s dawn and the evening with songs of joy.

name: Psalm 65:9
text: You visit the earth, and water it. You greatly enrich it. The river of God is full of water. You provide them grain, for so you have ordained it.

name: Psalm 65:10
text: You drench its furrows. You level its ridges. You soften it with showers. You bless it with a crop.

name: Psalm 65:11
text: You crown the year with your bounty. Your carts overflow with abundance.

name: Psalm 65:12
text: The wilderness grasslands overflow. The hills are clothed with gladness.

name: Psalm 65:13
text: The pastures are covered with flocks. The valleys also are clothed with grain. They shout for joy! They also sing.

name: Psalm 66:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A song. A Psalm. Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!

name: Psalm 66:2
text: Sing to the glory of his name! Offer glory and praise!

name: Psalm 66:3
text: Tell God, "How awesome are your deeds! Through the greatness of your power, your enemies submit themselves to you.

name: Psalm 66:4
text: All the earth will worship you, and will sing to you; they will sing to your name." Selah.

name: Psalm 66:5
text: Come, and see God"s deeds"awesome work on behalf of the children of men.

name: Psalm 66:6
text: He turned the sea into dry land. They went through the river on foot. There, we rejoiced in him.

name: Psalm 66:7
text: He rules by his might forever. His eyes watch the nations. Don"t let the rebellious rise up against him. Selah.

name: Psalm 66:8
text: Praise our God, you peoples! Make the sound of his praise heard,

name: Psalm 66:9
text: who preserves our life among the living, and doesn"t allow our feet to be moved.

name: Psalm 66:10
text: For you, God, have tested us. You have refined us, as silver is refined.

name: Psalm 66:11
text: You brought us into prison. You laid a burden on our backs.

name: Psalm 66:12
text: You allowed men to ride over our heads. We went through fire and through water, but you brought us to the place of abundance.

name: Psalm 66:13
text: I will come into your temple with burnt offerings. I will pay my vows to you,

name: Psalm 66:14
text: which my lips promised, and my mouth spoke, when I was in distress.

name: Psalm 66:15
text: I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat animals, with the offering of rams, I will offer bulls with goats. Selah.

name: Psalm 66:16
text: Come, and hear, all you who fear God. I will declare what he has done for my soul.

name: Psalm 66:17
text: I cried to him with my mouth. He was extolled with my tongue.

name: Psalm 66:18
text: If I cherished sin in my heart, the Lord wouldn"t have listened.

name: Psalm 66:19
text: But most certainly, God has listened. He has heard the voice of my prayer.

name: Psalm 66:20
text: Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer, nor his loving kindness from me.

name: Psalm 67:1
text: For the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Psalm. A song. May God be merciful to us, bless us, and cause his face to shine on us. Selah.

name: Psalm 67:2
text: That your way may be known on earth, and your salvation among all nations,

name: Psalm 67:3
text: let the peoples praise you, God. Let all the peoples praise you.

name: Psalm 67:4
text: Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you will judge the peoples with equity, and govern the nations on earth. Selah.

name: Psalm 67:5
text: Let the peoples praise you, God. Let all the peoples praise you.

name: Psalm 67:6
text: The earth has yielded its increase. God, even our own God, will bless us.

name: Psalm 67:7
text: God will bless us. All the ends of the earth shall fear him.

name: Psalm 68:1
text: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song. Let God arise! Let his enemies be scattered! Let them who hate him also flee before him.

name: Psalm 68:2
text: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away. As wax melts before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

name: Psalm 68:3
text: But let the righteous be glad. Let them rejoice before God. Yes, let them rejoice with gladness.

name: Psalm 68:4
text: Sing to God! Sing praises to his name! Extol him who rides on the clouds: to Yah, his name! Rejoice before him!

name: Psalm 68:5
text: A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

name: Psalm 68:6
text: God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

name: Psalm 68:7
text: God, when you went forth before your people, when you marched through the wilderness... Selah.

name: Psalm 68:8
text: The earth trembled. The sky also poured down rain at the presence of the God of Sinai"at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

name: Psalm 68:9
text: You, God, sent a plentiful rain. You confirmed your inheritance, when it was weary.

name: Psalm 68:10
text: Your congregation lived therein. You, God, prepared your goodness for the poor.

name: Psalm 68:11
text: The Lord announced the word. The ones who proclaim it are a great company.

name: Psalm 68:12
text: "Kings of armies flee! They flee!" She who waits at home divides the spoil,

name: Psalm 68:13
text: while you sleep among the campfires, the wings of a dove sheathed with silver, her feathers with shining gold.

name: Psalm 68:14
text: When the Almighty scattered kings in her, it snowed on Zalmon.

name: Psalm 68:15
text: The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains. The mountains of Bashan are rugged.

name: Psalm 68:16
text: Why do you look in envy, you rugged mountains, at the mountain where God chooses to reign? Yes, Yahweh will dwell there forever.

name: Psalm 68:17
text: The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands. The Lord is among them, from Sinai, into the sanctuary.

name: Psalm 68:18
text: You have ascended on high. You have led away captives. You have received gifts among men, yes, among the rebellious also, that Yah God might dwell there.

name: Psalm 68:19
text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears our burdens, even the God who is our salvation. Selah.

name: Psalm 68:20
text: God is to us a God of deliverance. To Yahweh, the Lord, belongs escape from death.

name: Psalm 68:21
text: But God will strike through the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of such a one as still continues in his guiltiness.

name: Psalm 68:22
text: The Lord said, "I will bring you again from Bashan, I will bring you again from the depths of the sea;

name: Psalm 68:23
text: That you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood, that the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies."

name: Psalm 68:24
text: They have seen your processions, God, even the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.

name: Psalm 68:25
text: The singers went before, the minstrels followed after, in the midst of the ladies playing with tambourines,

name: Psalm 68:26
text: "Bless God in the congregations, even the Lord in the assembly of Israel!"

name: Psalm 68:27
text: There is little Benjamin, their ruler, the princes of Judah, their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

name: Psalm 68:28
text: Your God has commanded your strength. Strengthen, God, that which you have done for us.

name: Psalm 68:29
text: Because of your temple at Jerusalem, kings shall bring presents to you.

name: Psalm 68:30
text: Rebuke the wild animal of the reeds, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples. Being humbled, may it bring bars of silver. Scatter the nations that delight in war.

name: Psalm 68:31
text: Princes shall come out of Egypt. Ethiopia shall hurry to stretch out her hands to God.

name: Psalm 68:32
text: Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth! Sing praises to the Lord! Selah.

name: Psalm 68:33
text: To him who rides on the heaven of heavens, which are of old; behold, he utters his voice, a mighty voice.

name: Psalm 68:34
text: Ascribe strength to God! His excellency is over Israel, his strength is in the skies.

name: Psalm 68:35
text: You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries. The God of Israel gives strength and power to his people. Praise be to God!

name: Psalm 69:1
text: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Lilies." By David. Save me, God, for the waters have come up to my neck!

name: Psalm 69:2
text: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold. I have come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

name: Psalm 69:3
text: I am weary with my crying. My throat is dry. My eyes fail, looking for my God.

name: Psalm 69:4
text: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head. Those who want to cut me off, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty. I have to restore what I didn"t take away.

name: Psalm 69:5
text: God, you know my foolishness. My sins aren"t hidden from you.

name: Psalm 69:6
text: Don"t let those who wait for you be shamed through me, Lord Yahweh of Armies. Don"t let those who seek you be brought to dishonor through me, God of Israel.

name: Psalm 69:7
text: Because for your sake, I have borne reproach. Shame has covered my face.

name: Psalm 69:8
text: I have become a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my mother"s children.

name: Psalm 69:9
text: For the zeal of your house consumes me. The reproaches of those who reproach you have fallen on me.

name: Psalm 69:10
text: When I wept and I fasted, that was to my reproach.

name: Psalm 69:11
text: When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword to them.

name: Psalm 69:12
text: Those who sit in the gate talk about me. I am the song of the drunkards.

name: Psalm 69:13
text: But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, in an acceptable time. God, in the abundance of your loving kindness, answer me in the truth of your salvation.

name: Psalm 69:14
text: Deliver me out of the mire, and don"t let me sink. Let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.

name: Psalm 69:15
text: Don"t let the flood waters overwhelm me, neither let the deep swallow me up. Don"t let the pit shut its mouth on me.

name: Psalm 69:16
text: Answer me, Yahweh, for your loving kindness is good. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, turn to me.

name: Psalm 69:17
text: Don"t hide your face from your servant, for I am in distress. Answer me speedily!

name: Psalm 69:18
text: Draw near to my soul, and redeem it. Ransom me because of my enemies.

name: Psalm 69:19
text: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor. My adversaries are all before you.

name: Psalm 69:20
text: Reproach has broken my heart, and I am full of heaviness. I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; for comforters, but I found none.

name: Psalm 69:21
text: They also gave me gall for my food. In my thirst, they gave me vinegar to drink.

name: Psalm 69:22
text: Let their table before them become a snare. May it become a retribution and a trap.

name: Psalm 69:23
text: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they can"t see. Let their backs be continually bent.

name: Psalm 69:24
text: Pour out your indignation on them. Let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.

name: Psalm 69:25
text: Let their habitation be desolate. Let no one dwell in their tents.

name: Psalm 69:26
text: For they persecute him whom you have wounded. They tell of the sorrow of those whom you have hurt.

name: Psalm 69:27
text: Charge them with crime upon crime. Don"t let them come into your righteousness.

name: Psalm 69:28
text: Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and not be written with the righteous.

name: Psalm 69:29
text: But I am in pain and distress. Let your salvation, God, protect me.

name: Psalm 69:30
text: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

name: Psalm 69:31
text: It will please Yahweh better than an ox, or a bull that has horns and hoofs.

name: Psalm 69:32
text: The humble have seen it, and are glad. You who seek after God, let your heart live.

name: Psalm 69:33
text: For Yahweh hears the needy, and doesn"t despise his captive people.

name: Psalm 69:34
text: Let heaven and earth praise him; the seas, and everything that moves therein!

name: Psalm 69:35
text: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah. They shall settle there, and own it.

name: Psalm 69:36
text: The children also of his servants shall inherit it. Those who love his name shall dwell therein.

name: Psalm 70:1
text: For the Chief Musician. By David. A reminder. Hurry, God, to deliver me. Come quickly to help me, Yahweh.

name: Psalm 70:2
text: Let them be disappointed and confounded who seek my soul. Let those who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.

name: Psalm 70:3
text: Let them be turned because of their shame Who say, "Aha! Aha!"

name: Psalm 70:4
text: Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Let those who love your salvation continually say, "Let God be exalted!"

name: Psalm 70:5
text: But I am poor and needy. Come to me quickly, God. You are my help and my deliverer. Yahweh, don"t delay.

name: Psalm 71:1
text: In you, Yahweh, I take refuge. Never let me be disappointed.

name: Psalm 71:2
text: Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me. Turn your ear to me, and save me.

name: Psalm 71:3
text: Be to me a rock of refuge to which I may always go. Give the command to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.

name: Psalm 71:4
text: Rescue me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

name: Psalm 71:5
text: For you are my hope, Lord Yahweh; my confidence from my youth.

name: Psalm 71:6
text: I have relied on you from the womb. You are he who took me out of my mother"s womb. I will always praise you.

name: Psalm 71:7
text: I am a marvel to many, but you are my strong refuge.

name: Psalm 71:8
text: My mouth shall be filled with your praise, with your honor all the day.

name: Psalm 71:9
text: Don"t reject me in my old age. Don"t forsake me when my strength fails.

name: Psalm 71:10
text: For my enemies talk about me. Those who watch for my soul conspire together,

name: Psalm 71:11
text: saying, "God has forsaken him. Pursue and take him, for no one will rescue him."

name: Psalm 71:12
text: God, don"t be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.

name: Psalm 71:13
text: Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed. Let them be covered with disgrace and scorn who want to harm me.

name: Psalm 71:14
text: But I will always hope, and will add to all of your praise.

name: Psalm 71:15
text: My mouth will tell about your righteousness, and of your salvation all day, though I don"t know its full measure.

name: Psalm 71:16
text: I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Yahweh. I will make mention of your righteousness, even of yours alone.

name: Psalm 71:17
text: God, you have taught me from my youth. Until now, I have declared your wondrous works.

name: Psalm 71:18
text: Yes, even when I am old and gray-haired, God, don"t forsake me, until I have declared your strength to the next generation, your might to everyone who is to come.

name: Psalm 71:19
text: Your righteousness also, God, reaches to the heavens; you have done great things. God, who is like you?

name: Psalm 71:20
text: You, who have shown us many and bitter troubles, you will let me live. You will bring us up again from the depths of the earth.

name: Psalm 71:21
text: Increase my honor, and comfort me again.

name: Psalm 71:22
text: I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God. I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

name: Psalm 71:23
text: My lips shall shout for joy! My soul, which you have redeemed, sings praises to you!

name: Psalm 71:24
text: My tongue will also talk about your righteousness all day long, for they are disappointed, and they are confounded, who want to harm me.

name: Psalm 72:1
text: By Solomon. God, give the king your justice; your righteousness to the royal son.

name: Psalm 72:2
text: He will judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.

name: Psalm 72:3
text: The mountains shall bring prosperity to the people. The hills bring the fruit of righteousness.

name: Psalm 72:4
text: He will judge the poor of the people. He will save the children of the needy, and will break the oppressor in pieces.

name: Psalm 72:5
text: They shall fear you while the sun endures; and as long as the moon, throughout all generations.

name: Psalm 72:6
text: He will come down like rain on the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.

name: Psalm 72:7
text: In his days, the righteous shall flourish, and abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.

name: Psalm 72:8
text: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, from the River to the ends of the earth.

name: Psalm 72:9
text: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him. His enemies shall lick the dust.

name: Psalm 72:10
text: The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute. The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

name: Psalm 72:11
text: Yes, all kings shall fall down before him. All nations shall serve him.

name: Psalm 72:12
text: For he will deliver the needy when he cries; the poor, who has no helper.

name: Psalm 72:13
text: He will have pity on the poor and needy. He will save the souls of the needy.
